be.jonaseveraert.util.audio

Class WavFileBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • be.jonaseveraert.util.audio.WavFileBuilder

  • public class WavFileBuilder
extends Object
    Class for building Wav files.

    In the see also, I linked some resources that were key to making this class. (The first one is especially helpful if you want to understand how the wav file is made)

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    %I%
    Author:
    Jonas Everaert, jonaseveraert.be
    See Also:
    WAVE PCM soundfile format. Stanford.edu (Dec 10, 2008). Wayback machine link, Java Sound Tutorials. Java Docs (27 may 2021).

    • Constructor Detail

      • WavFileBuilder

        public WavFileBuilder(int audioFormat,
                      int numChannels,
                      int sampleRate,
                      int bitsPerSample)

        Constructs a WavFileBuilder which can be used to create wav files.

        The builder takes care of the subchunks based on the parameters that are given in the constructor.

        Adding audio to the wav file

        There are 2 methods that can be used to add audio data to the WavFile. One is addBytes which lets you directly inject bytes into the data section of the wav file. The other is addAudioFile which lets you add the audio data of another file to the wav file's audio data.
        Parameters:
        audioFormat - The be.jonaseveraert.util.audio format of the wav file PCM = 1
        numChannels - The number of channels the wav file will have MONO = 1, STEREO = 2
        sampleRate - The sample rate of the wav file in Hz (e.g. 22050, 44100, ...)
        bitsPerSample - The amount of bits per sample. If 16 bits, the be.jonaseveraert.util.audio sample will contain 2 bytes per channel. (e.g. 8, 16, ...). This is important to take into account when using the addBytes method to insert data into the wav file.

      • WavFileBuilder

        public WavFileBuilder(int audioFormat,
                      int numChannels,
                      int sampleRate,
                      int bitsPerSample,
                      ProgressBarHandler pbHandler)

        Constructs a WavFileBuilder which can be used to create wav files.

        The builder takes care of the subchunks based on the parameters that are given in the constructor.

        Adding audio to the wav file

        There are 2 methods that can be used to add audio data to the WavFile. One is addBytes which lets you directly inject bytes into the data section of the wav file. The other is addAudioFile which lets you add the be.jonaseveraert.util.audio data of another file to the wav file's audio data.
        Parameters:
        audioFormat - The audio format of the wav file PCM = 1
        numChannels - The number of channels the wav file will have MONO = 1, STEREO = 2
        sampleRate - The sample rate of the wav file in Hz (e.g. 22050, 44100, ...)
        bitsPerSample - The amount of bits per sample. If 16 bits, the audio sample will contain 2 bytes per channel. (e.g. 8, 16, ...). This is important to take into account when using the addBytes method to insert data into the wav file.
        pbHandler - A ProgressBarHandler can be any class that implements the ProgressBarHandler interface. This object will be used to manipulate a progressbar depending on how much work the process of saving the audio still has left.

    • Method Detail

      • addBytes

        public void addBytes(byte[] audioBytes)
        Adds audio data to the wav file from bytes

        See the "see also" for the structure of the "Data" part of a wav file

        Parameters:
        audioBytes - be.jonaseveraert.util.audio data
        See Also:
        Wave PCM Soundfile Format

      • addAudioFile

        public boolean addAudioFile(File file)
        Adds the be.jonaseveraert.util.audio data from a wav file to the wav file you are creating
        Parameters:
        file - a wav file with the same parameters as the WavFileBuilder.
        Returns:
        true if the file's be.jonaseveraert.util.audio data was successfully added to the wav file's audioData byte array, false otherwise

      • saveFile

        public boolean saveFile(File outputFile)
                 throws IOException
        Saves the file to the location of the outputFile.
        Parameters:
        outputFile - The file that will be outputted (not created yet), contains the path
        Returns:
        true if the file was created and written to successfully. Else false.
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurred
